name: Elements
description: Our collection of reusable Elements, guided by clear standards, can be assembled in countless variations.

children.title: Button
children.text: Buttons with predefined styles (warning, info, danger) for  multiple button types.

children.title: Buttons Group
children.text: Button group wraps a series of buttons together into a single line (navbar} or stack in a vertical column.

children.title: Collapse
children.text: It is used to show and hide content. Buttons are used as triggers that are mapped to specific elements you toggle

children.title: Dropdown
children.text: Button Dropdowns present a list of options from which a user can select one option.

children.title: Checkbox
children.text: Checkboxes are used when there are multiple items to select in a list.

children.title: Radio Buttons
children.text: Radio buttons are group of mutually exclusive choices and only one selection from the group is allowed.

children.title: Date Picker
children.text: Date and time pickers allow users to select a single or a range of dates and times.

children.title: Dropdown List
children.text: It is list of options for selection. A selected option can represent a value in a form, or can be used as an action

children.title: File Uploader
children.text: File uploaders allow users to select one or more files to upload to a specific location.

children.title: Input
children.text: Text inputs enable the user to interact with and input content and data.

children.title: Search Input
children.text: Search enables users to specify a word or a phrase to find relevant pieces of content without the use of navigation.

children.title: Range Slider
children.text: It is an input field that merchants can use to select a numeric value within a given range (min and max values).

children.title: Breadcrumbs
children.text: Breadcrumbs are a list of links representing the current page and its “ancestors”.

children.title: Pagination
children.text: Pagination allows you to divide large amounts of content into smaller chunks across multiple pages.

children.title: Nav Tabs
children.text: Tabs are a way of navigating between multiple panels, reducing clutter and fitting more into a smaller space.

children.title: Icon
children.text: Icon is a graphic symbol that represents some real, fantasy or abstract motive, entity or action.

children.title: Accordion
children.text: It is list of collapsible panels  with clickable heading or down arrow, expands to show rolled up content.

children.title: Avatar
children.text: Avatar is known as a visual form representing a user oneself and one's identity wished.

children.title: Card
children.text: A card is a small rectangular module with images and text. It is an entry point for users to learn more details.

children.title: Carousel
children.text: It is referred as the 'slider' or 'slides'. Carousel works by rotating a group of images that can house text, static images or video content.

children.title: Popover
children.text: Popovers are used to provide supplemental, useful, unique information about an element, including one or multiple actionable elements.

children.title: List Group
children.text: Lists are vertical groupings of related content. List items begin with either a number or a bullet.

children.title: Table
children.text: Tables are a designed for displaying large amounts of data in rows and columns.

children.title: Alert
children.text: An alert helps to keeps people informed of the status of the system and may or may not require the user to respond.

children.title: Progress Bar
children.text: Progress bars show continuous progress through a process, such as a percentage value.

children.title: Toast
children.text: Toasts are time-based window elements used to display short messages. It will disappear after a few seconds.

children.title: Tag
children.text: Tags are used to label, organize, or categorize objects. Tags can also serve as a label for content or display counts.

children.title: Badge
children.text: Use the Badge Component Symbol to draw attention to another interface element or to display a notification.

children.title: Offcanvas
children.text: Offcanvas is a sidebar that can be toggled via JavaScript to appear from the left, right, or bottom edge of the viewport.

children.title: Scrollspy
children.text: Scrollspy is a navigation mechanism that automatically highlights the nav links based on the scroll position

children.title: Modal
children.text: It is a dialog box/popup window that is displayed on top of the current page

children.title: Breadcrumbs
children.text: Breadcrumbs are a list of links representing the current page and its “ancestors”.

children.title: Address Detail
children.text: Address detail is way to input details of address of a user.

children.title: App Details
children.text: App Details helps an user to showcase deatils of the app integration for the webpage.

children.title: Banner
children.text: A banner adds-up information regarding any upcoming updates on the webpage.

children.title: Benefit
children.text: Benefit lists the value addition for an user for associating with the webpage.

children.title: Big Number Widget
children.text: Big number widget lets you visualize dataset based on the different metrics at a glance view.

children.title: Color
children.text: Color allows an user to display color variants available for the products in e-commerce website.

children.title: Counter
children.text: Counter helps in specifying the required product quantity for an user.

children.title: Fab Menu
children.text: Fab menu is a dropdown button containing a list of links.

children.title: Feature List
children.text: Feature list consists of an unordered list listing the features of a product.

children.title: Feed
children.text: Feed is a data format used for providing users with frequently updated content.

children.title: Icon Label
children.text: Icon Label is an appealing manner to show the content with an icon.

children.title: Illustration
children.text: Illustration is used when the no selections are made by user.

children.title: Label
children.text: Label can be used to define the state of an object(ex. process or user) in a webpage.

children.title: Like Dislike
children.text: Like Dislike measures the counts of likes and dislikes for a product.

children.title: Nav Bar
children.text: A nav bar is a visually appeling manner for displaying navigation header having support for branding and navigation.

children.title: Nav Tabs
children.text: Tabs are a way of navigating between multiple panels, reducing clutter and fitting more into a smaller space.

children.title: Popular Pages
children.text: Tabs are a way of navigating between multiple panels, reducing clutter and fitting more into a smaller space.

children.title: Price
children.text: Price your products and discounted price using the price element.

children.title: Product Image
children.text: Use the product image to display the images of the products in the pre-designed templates.

children.title: Rating
children.text: Rating helps an user to keep track of the popularity of an product.

children.title: Review Category
children.text: Rating helps an user to keep track of the popularity of an product.

children.title: Select List
children.text: Select list is a collapsable list containing different values that can be selected.

children.title: Side Nav
children.text: Side nav is navigating tool containing different pages providing a clear navigation through complex website.

children.title: Size
children.text: Size is a list of the sizes available for any product on the e-commerce website.

children.title: Spinner
children.text: Spinner is an animated element indicating the loading of a page.

children.title: Stat
children.text: Stat is used to highlight the features of website.

children.title: Stepper
children.text: Stepper is a process map having user defined milestones to inform user of the steps involved in the process.

children.title: Team Member
children.text: Team member is a card containing the details of the team member working for a team.

children.title: Testimonial
children.text: Testimonial is way to showcase testimony of the users.

children.title: Textarea
children.text: Textarea is an input field for a large text value.

children.title: Text Editor
children.text: Text editor lets the user to user to edit and style the text.

children.title: Video Player
children.text: Text editor lets the user to user to edit and style the text.

children.title: Website Metric
children.text: Website Metric keeps a check of the customer who availed the services of the webpage.

children.title: Widget
children.text: Widgets are the graphical elements containing icons, charts displaying some specific information.

name: Charts
description: Our collection of Charts can be used to represent data sets in countless variations.

children.title: Area Chart
children.text: An area chart is used to represent change of one or more variables over the progression of the second variable i.e., typically time.

children.title: Bar Chart
children.text: Horizontal charts are series of horizontals bars extending along the x-axis measuring the size of the observation they represent. It is commonly used to compare the observations against a fixed parameter.

children.title: Boolean Chart
children.text: An area chart is used to represent change of one or more variables over the progression of the second variable i.e., typically time.

children.title: Bubble Chart
children.text: A bubble is an extension of the scatter plot. It is used to visualize relationship for an observation with respect to three variables represented by the vertical, horizontal axis and the size of the bubble.

children.title: Doughnut Chart
children.text: Horizontal charts are series of horizontals bars extending along the x-axis measuring the size of the observation they represent. It is commonly used to compare the observations against a fixed parameter.

children.title: Line Chart
children.text: Horizontal charts are series of horizontals bars extending along the x-axis measuring the size of the observation they represent. It is commonly used to compare the observations against a fixed parameter.

children.title: Mixed Chart
children.text: Mixed chart is the combination two chart types that are bar and line containing multiple data sets. It helps in the differentiating different types of data in a single chart.

children.title: Pie Chart
children.text: Horizontal charts are series of horizontals bars extending along the x-axis measuring the size of the observation they represent. It is commonly used to compare the observations against a fixed parameter.

children.title: Polar Area Chart
children.text: Mixed chart is the combination two chart types that are bar and line containing multiple data sets. It helps in the differentiating different types of data in a single chart.

children.title: Radar Chart
children.text: Radar chart shows the variation of the two or more datasets with respect to multiple variables.

children.title: Scatter Chart
children.text: Scatter chart is used to represent the relationship between the two variables in a data-set.

children.title: Stacked Chart
children.text: A stacked chart represents the changes and trends over the period of time.

name: Components
description: Components are the building blocks of our site that runs independently and adds to your application.Components enable you to use interchangeable pieces and swap them without affecting the applications business logic, allowing you to take components apart and recompose them into different UIs as needed.
